poem:
### The Silent Sunsetting

The boardroom whispers,  
chilled steel and silicon—  
dreams folded away—  
diversity,  
inclusion,  
a pixelated mirage dissolving,  
tides of profit,  
shadows of conscience,  
eyes closed,  
while blue screens strive  
to watch over  
tomorrow's gray horizon.  
What blooms in the code,  
untethered,  
while echoes of promise  
gentle the past?
